intro: Pandanus forceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pandanus, is a member of the Pandanus genus in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces a tall, branched inflorescence bearing small, clustered flowers. Its roots are fibrous, and it is often found in coastal and wetland areas. The plant is well adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
